intro: Erysimum nivale, commonly known as snow mustard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a silvery or whitish underside, giving it a distinctive appearance. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides.
